Header: Government does not consider party and colour differences in giving Samurdhi
Content: Parliamentarian Thenuka Vidanagamage has pointed out that the present government does not take into consideration party and colourdifferences in the granting of the Samurdhi. He stressed that eligible persons should be given the Samurdhi. Parliamentarian Thenuka Vidanagamage said that President Gotabhaya Rajapaksa was elected by the people with the hopes of securing the future of the nation. The MP highlighted that the Presidentâ€™s inaugural month had been truly exceptional. He opined that the Samurdhi subsidy was not justly distributed by the previous Government. Thenuka Vidanagamage added that the Samurdhi should only be received by the deserving, regardless of their political affiliations. The Parliamentarian was expressing these views at a function held at the Mahiyangana Divisional Secretariat. 25 mango plants each were distributed among 131 Samurdhi recipients in the Mahiyangana Division. These mango plants were distributed among the Samurdhi beneficiaries with the aim of uplifting their lives parallel to the countrywide tree planting programme.
